results.abstract: Boyle, T Coraghessan: Descent of Man revd by Max Apple

headline.main: Characters in Search of a Difference; Boyle

results.snippet: VOLUME of stories, bereft of continuity in plot and character, is often unified only by the writer's obsessiveness. A certain restlessness, a temporary energy takes over, a singing in the brain that is too intense to live with for the duration
results.lead_paragraph: VOLUME of stories, bereft of continuity in plot and character, is often unified only by the writer's obsessiveness. A certain restlessness, a temporary energy takes over, a singing in the brain that is too intense to live with for the duration

results.abstract: Article on auto racing safety seminar at Auto Expo NY international show (M)

headline.main: Seminar to Discuss Auto Racing Safety; Pioneer in Satety Exclusivity Is Maintained

results.snippet: The late Mark Donohue had a keen interest in eliminating, or at least controlling, some of the dangers in racecar driving. Perhaps more than any other driver of his era, he understood race cars; how they worked, why they worked and his relationship...
results.lead_paragraph: The late Mark Donohue had a keen interest in eliminating, or at least controlling, some of the dangers in racecar driving. Perhaps more than any other driver of his era, he understood race cars; how they worked, why they worked and his relationship to them.

results.abstract: USSR launches Soyuz 33 with Soviet cosmonaut Nikolai Rukavishnikov and Bulgarian Maj Georgi Ivanov aboard; Soyuz will dock with orbiting Salyut space station, which contains cosmonauts Vladimir Lyakhov and Valery Ryumin; US scientist Dr Charles S Sheldon speculates that Ryumin and Lyakhov, who have been in orbit for 46 days may be trying for 6-mo flight record; Ivanov illus (M)

headline.main: Russian and Guest From Bulgaria On Way to Visit 2 in Space Station; No Timetable Announced Goal May Be Six-Month Stay

results.snippet: The Soviet orbiting station Salyut 6 has become an international meeting place in space, with Czechoslovak, Polish and East German astronauts working there from time to time with their Russian counterparts, and now a Bulgarian astronaut is on his way...
results.lead_paragraph: The Soviet orbiting station Salyut 6 has become an international meeting place in space, with Czechoslovak, Polish and East German astronauts working there from time to time with their Russian counterparts, and now a Bulgarian astronaut is on his way for a visit. He was launched yesterday aboard Soyuz 33.

results.abstract: Rukavishnikov and Ivanov prepare to return to earth after failing to dock with orbiting Salyut space station; docking canceled because of maneuvering problems (S)

headline.main: ASTRONAUTS CANCEL LINKUP WITH SALYUT; Moscow Radio Cites Problem With Maneuvering of Soyuz Craft

results.snippet: LONDON, Thursday, April 12 (Reuters) Moscow Radio said today that the Soyuz 33 spacecraft's docking mission with an orbiting space station had been canceled and that the two astronauts on board Soyuz were preparing to return to earth.
results.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Thursday, April 12 (Reuters) Moscow Radio said today that the Soyuz 33 spacecraft's docking mission with an orbiting space station had been canceled and that the two astronauts on board Soyuz were preparing to return to earth.

headline.main: 2 ASTRONAUTS LAND AFTER LINKUP FAILS; Soviet Cites Guidance Problem on Soyuz Craft as the Reason for Ending Docking Mission

results.snippet: MOSCOW, April 12 (AP)--The Soviet and a Bulgarian astronaut team returned safely to earth tonight after aborting an attempted linkup with an orbiting space laboratory, the Moscow radio reported.
results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, April 12 (AP)--The Soviet and a Bulgarian astronaut team returned safely to earth tonight after aborting an attempted linkup with an orbiting space laboratory, the Moscow radio reported.

results.abstract: Prof Eugene Kennedy recounts his int with mythology scholar Joseph Campbell on function of myths; por; illus (L)

results.snippet: At 75, Joseph Campbell, New Yorker by birth, affection and the softest of accents, is considered to be the foremost American scholar in the field of mythology. Although the word is popularly used to denote falsehood, ...

results.abstract: California Gov Edmund Brown says US should give up on nuclear power as future energy source rather than speed up licensing procedures, as Pres Carter has urged; stresses differences with Carter (M)

headline.main: Gov. Brown, Differing With Carter, Bids U.S. Abandon Nuclear Energy; Stand Reflects Poll Finding A More Complicated Question Statutes Called Too Simple

results.snippet: LOS ANGELES, April 25--Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. says that the nation should give up on nuclear power as a future energy source rather than speed up the licensing, procedures for power plants, as President Carter has urged.

byline.original: By ADAM CLYMER Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, April 25--Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr. says that the nation should give up on nuclear power as a future energy source rather than speed up the licensing, procedures for power plants, as President Carter has urged.

results.abstract: Cambodian Govt accuses Thailand of 'false neutrality' and warns it to stop aiding Pol Pot forces in escaping into southwest Cambodia; Vietnamese opened campaign month ago to clear guerrillas from western Cambodia; drive apparently has been effective in northwest, but thousands escaped into Thailand and headed for southwest Cambodia, reptdly taking with them thousands of civilians, many apparently against their will (S)
